intro: Echeveria pringlei var. longisepala, commonly known as the Long-sepaled Echeveria, is a succulent native to Mexico. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-gray in color, with a slight powdery coating. The plant produces vibrant pink or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright sunlight to maintain its compact shape. Due to its striking appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
